intro: Jasminanthes mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have a distinct mucronate tip, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
